result.execSummary:
The defendant Sheryl L Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sheryl L Wilson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sheryl L Wilson was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all prison wages at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.
Concurrent with: 13CF315

miscConds.notes: Bond amount posted shall be applied and applied to costs in 13CF315.  If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or combination thereof to equal full time.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance without a valid prescription and then taken as prescribed.  

Defednant shall not enter any establishments where primary purpose is the sale or service of alcohol. 

Defendant shall not have contact with Amy P.; Ladonna M.; Jessee G.; Amanda W. or Jessica L.  

Defendant shall not associate with any known drug dealers or users.

Defendant shall not be present where drugs are used, stored, packaged or sold.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with recommendations.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Defendant shall notify the probation agent of all medications prescribed and notify within 48 hours of any change in medications.

Defendant shall notify providers of medications and of the heroin addiction.

Defendant shall submit to random drug and alcohol screens.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Stayed and to be used at the discretion of the probation agent.  With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

State indicates upon plea to Ct. 7, recommend Ct. 5, Ct. 6, Ct. 8 and Ct. 9 be dismissed for read-in along with 13CM1348 and 14CF266 and agree to read-in an uncharged offense from JPD from 3-17-14 for Possession of Heroin and Possession of Drug Paraphernalia and rqst. PSI with both sides free to argue.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information w/i 48 hours. State does make a request on the bail, Atty. Schmaus rqst. bond continue as ordered.  Court revokes the bond.   Atty. Schmaus rqst. Huber privileges, Court maintains bond being revoked.
